intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis maculosa, commonly known as the spotted pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small epiphytic orchid, typically growing on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink. Its flowers are usually clustered in racemes and bloom during the warmer months. Due to its striking appearance and rarity, it is often sought after by orchid enthusiasts and conservationists alike.
